My first post

19 Dec 2013

The Ruby on Rails application Article-Level Metrics (ALM) was started in March 2009 by the Open Access publisher Public Library of Science (PLOS). It allows a user to aggregate relevant performance data on research articles including online usage, citations, and altmetrics. We’re continuing to expand the Article-Level Metrics application because we believe that articles should be considered on their own merits, and that the impact of an individual article should not be determined by the journal in which it happened to be published. As a result, we hope that new ways of measuring and evaluating research quality (or ‘impact’) can and will evolve.

Read more …
